Package edu.cornell.gdiac.json

Class PlatformModel

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.Obstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.SimpleObstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.BoxObstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.json.PlatformModel
public class PlatformModel extends BoxObstacle
A polygon shape representing the screen boundary Note that the constructor does very little. The true initialization happens by reading the JSON value. In addition, this class overrides the drawing and positioning functions to provide a tiled texture.

  • Method Details

    • initRegion

      private void initRegion()
      Initializes a PolygonRegion to support a tiled texture In order to keep the texture uniform, the drawing polygon position needs to be absolute. However, this can cause a problem when we want to move the platform (e.g. a dynamic platform). The purpose of the texture anchor is to ensure that the texture does not move as the object moves.

    • setTexture

      public void setTexture(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion value)
      Sets the object texture for drawing purposes. In order for drawing to work properly, you MUST set the drawScale. The drawScale converts the physics units to pixels.
      Overrides:
      setTexture in class SimpleObstacle
      Parameters:
      value - the object texture for drawing purposes.

    • setDrawScale

      public void setDrawScale(float x, float y)
      Sets the drawing scale for this physics object The drawing scale is the number of pixels to draw before Box2D unit. Because mass is a function of area in Box2D, we typically want the physics objects to be small. So we decouple that scale from the physics object. However, we must track the scale difference to communicate with the scene graph. We allow for the scaling factor to be non-uniform.
      Overrides:
      setDrawScale in class Obstacle
      Parameters:
      x - the x-axis scale for this physics object
      y - the y-axis scale for this physics object

    • initialize

      public void initialize(AssetDirectory directory, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue json)
      Initializes the platform via the given JSON value The JSON value has been parsed and is part of a bigger level file. However, this JSON value is limited to the platform subtree
      Parameters:
      directory - the asset manager
      json - the JSON subtree defining the platform
